newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens wins Kazakh fiber optic contract.
newsitem.headline: Siemens wins Kazakh fiber optic contract.

text.p: German industrial group Siemens AG said on Tuesday its public networking unit won a 20 million mark order for a fiber optic link in the former Soviet republic of Kazakhstan.
The 1,600-kilometer link would complete the Trans-Asia Europe (TAE) line stretching from Shanghai in eastern China to Frankfurt.

The Kazakh portion of the TAE was expected to be completed by December and would have a capacity of 8,000 voice calls with digital quality, Siemens said. Of 16.5 million people in Kazakhstan, about 2.3 million would have access to the line.
The public networking unit of Siemens provides equipment and cables to pulbic phone companies. It sales rose 31 percent to 6.3 billion marks in the first half of 1996/97.
